item.title: Evaluating the closed form coefficients of Laguerre polynomials
item.description: Evaluating the closed form coefficients of Laguerre polynomials For some numerical applications it can be useful to work with the closed form expression for Laguerre polynomials. The closed form is given by $$L_n(x) = \sum_{k=0}^n {n \choose k} \frac{(-1)^k}{k!} x^k$$ (1) We can evaluate the coefficients with the help of the factorial formula $$\binom{n}{k} = \frac{n!}{k!\,(n-k)!}$$ (2) Since $n$ and $k$ are both integers, the coefficients are rational numbers.

item.title: Code development
item.description: In my free time I like to work on scientific coding projects in Fortran. Fortran interfaces Fortran 2003 added features for interoperability with the C programming language. These can be accesed through the intrinsic iso_c_binding module and allow smooth interfacing between the two languages for a certain set of interoperable types. This way Fortran programmers can gain access to the numerous libraries written in C/C++ and vice versa.
